While Winona Ryder and Vanessa Paradis will not be called on to testify, their witness statements were released and available to read online.

They’re running behind, so Amber Heard will not take the stand tomorrow. She’ll have the whole weekend to best figure out how to spin some damage control, if she doesn’t spend the time clubbing or shopping.

There isn’t a schedule yet as to who will appear next, or when, but here’s a suggested list of who might take the stand tomorrow. Isaac Baruch, artist and friend of Johnny Depp. Travis McGivern, Building manager at the Eastern Columbia Building. And Katherine Kendall, an actor and #metoo advocate.

On a personal note, it’s been suggested that I take these updates too personally. Yes, I do, especially when a woman’s survival of rape is stolen and twisted by a narcissistic sociopath to read like it’s her own story, I do take it very personally. As a survivor, a woman, and as a human being. And I will NOT apologize for that.

More as it happens, folks.

title: Amber Heard's new Low
description:
I have to admit that I was a little late to the game today. I did finally catch up and read all the tremendous live tweets from Nick Wallis. And I started to write a blow-by-blow series of events like I did yesterday, but there was one thing that happened today that I just can’t get past.

Kate James (KJ) was Amber Heard’s personal assistant. As such, Amber heard about a horrific incident that had happened in Kate’s life. When she was 26, Kate was raped at machete point for hours and barely escaped with her life.

And now, we find out that Amber Heard has taken that story and twisted it around as if it’s her own story.

I could go on and on about how this is textbook behavior for a narcissistic sociopath, but frankly, I’m too disgusted to look up the references. They’re out there if you want to look ‘em up yourself.

This perverted, despicable action is reportedly described in Amber Heard’s witness statement, to which we can’t be privy until after she’s been sworn in. So we’ll have to wait and see how similar Amber’s story is to Kates.

On a personal note, I can’t begin to describe how vile it is for Amber to take the single worst moment of a person’s life and use it for her own personal gain. What gain? I can only speculate that she’s going to accuse Johnny of being the one that raped her. I knew she was going to pull something for sympathy when she hit the stand, but I didn’t know that it would be this repugnant. Not only to potentially lie about Johnny raping her, but also to steal someone’s real life story to do it. As a survivor myself, I am deeply appalled and offended on every level.

Amber Heard is supposed to take the stand on Friday, if everything stays remotely on schedule. We’ll see then how low Amber has sunk in her crusade to vilify Johnny Depp. And how severely she’ll test my gag reflex.

SOURCE

title: Poopgate Pictures
description:
Malcolm Connolly was a security person for Johnny Depp and Amber Heard. He was asked about several instances including the time on the honeymoon train, citing journal entries that accuse Johnny of beating her up, and never mind the fact that, yet again, she doesn’t have a mark on her. He, on the other hand, is sporting a huge shiner. Oh his honeymoom.

Moving on to the topic of Australia, QC tried to insinuate that, because of all the different stories that came out, that Amber didn’t chop off Johnny’s finger at all. Maybe Johnny did it himself on that accordion door, which Malcolm insisted is impossible because the door has a safety feature.

Queen’s Counsel, (QC) also insinuated that Johnny injured Amber despite the fact that she was searing a slip when Malcolm arrived first, and she didn’t have a mark on her. Scratches on her arms didn’t appear until after Jerry Judge, Johnny’s long-time head of security, showed up. In other words, those scratches were more likely than not self-inflicted.

When QC’s insinuations didn’t sway Malcolm to change his answers, she made it seem that Johnny was on drugs, as usual.

Redirect clarified that Malcolm simply never saw any injuries on Amber Heard. He, Malcolm, wouldn’t tolerate any man hitting a woman. Not Johnny Depp. Not even the Pope. On the other hand, Malcolm recounts being asked to intervene because Amber heard kept hitting Johnny repeatedly. Malcolm also assures the court that he has not been pressured in any way into testifying on Johnny Depp’s behalf.

Tara Roberts, (TR) is Johnny Depp’s Bahamian estate manager. QC started by insinuating that TR relies upon JD for her home and income, so she’d lie for him. TR insists that she’s got other family income. She’d be sad if she lost the job because of all the friends she’s made, but that she wouldn’t be financially devastated. She’s got no reason to lie to keep her job, and wouldn’t anyway.

QC tried to debunk TR’s statement that Johnny has never been violent toward people by showing that TMZ video. TR wouldn’t change her statement that Johnny isn’t violent or that Amber had no injuries on the island. So, unable to make any headway with her, QC let her off the hook.

Redirect cleared up that TR never saw Johnny hit or abuse Amber Heard or any other person. And that Amber never showed any injuries. But she did see Amber Heard being violent toward Johnny Depp, causing injuries including a gash across the bridge of his nose.

No further questions.

Samantha MCmillen (SM) is Johnny Depp’s stylist since 2002, for 18 years now. She also worked as a stylist for Amber Heard while she and Johnny were together. SM confirmed what she’s been saying the whole time that when Amber Heard appeared on the James Cordon show, she displayed no injuries despite insisting that she had two black eyes.

Hilda Vargas (HV) has been Johnny Depp’s housekeeper for 30 years. She’s the one that found poop in Johnny Depp’s bed. QC tried to blame it on the dogs by saying that Depp’s dog Boo has a history of having accidents. HV clarified that the dogs have accidents “On the floor.” Both Pistol and Boo are too small to jump on the bed, and have never had an accident in the bed. She’s cleaned up after Boo many times, so she can say with authority that the poops were too big to have come from him. QC tried to suggest that Amber Heard was already gone for a full day at Coachella before the poop happened, but HV stuck to her story that Johnny was gone, and the poop was fresh. QC says that HV was angry, and HV admits that she felt disrespected to be left a mess like that because this sort of thing hasn’t happened 30 years of Working for Johnny Depp.

Redirect clarified HV’s statements, and included that HV also saw Amber in May of 2016 without any injuries on her.

The Photo of the poop has been released to the media.

title: Amber Turd Trending
description:
Today's update is going to be short and sweet. Amber Turd is trending in the UK after mention of that nickname was made in court. So much so that the Star has picked it up for the front page. 

The Sun, who Depp is currently suing for libel, has picked up on it, too. Seems their support for Amber Tu...er, Heard has soured. They're also talking about our little petition, here. We're in the news, folks.

See the whole photo of the Star's front page HERE.

title: Johnny Depp in Court: Day 4
description:
Johnny seemed very confident today even though QC badgered him and called him a liar with every other breath and brought his dying mother into it. Really low blow.

QC tried to paint Johnny as a drug-addicted monster that walks around in a rage all the time. She failed miserably, because quite simply, that isn’t true.

QC went into that final night, the one where Amber insists that Johnny threw a cell phone at her face.

I’d like to interject here that if you haven’t seen Brian’s videos, be sure to check him out. He debunks her version of events with clear and concise logic that’s infallible. You can find him HERE.

They brought up our little petition in court today. It had been suggested that he had something to do with creating the petition back when Amber Heard was in AM1. Johnny said that the petition came “years later.” So take heart in knowing that he’s aware of us, my friends.

After a 5 (or so) session where testimony was given in chambers, David Sherborne (DS) redirected Johnny for an hour before the lunch break and an hour afterward.

DS asked about the people Johnny surrounds himself with. QC had painted them as yes men who wouldn’t interfere while He was slapping his wife around. DS gave Johnny a chance to testify that such is not true. His entourage wouldn’t stand idly by while such a thing happened, which was never a problem because it never happened.

The main difference between QC’s cross examination and DS’s redirect is that DS asked questions in a brief and concise manner. And he allowed Johnny to complete his answers instead of cutting him off, which QC did almost constantly. It was a very efficient way of conducting business. In two hours, DS debunked the accusations about Johnny’s violent nature that QC spent 3.5 days trying to construct.

Also debunked were the accusations that Johnny acquired massive amounts of drugs for only himself. Amber Heard’s medical records of the time showed that she had, indeed, ingested or otherwise used (abused?) drugs, including some that Johnny doesn’t even use.

After Johnny was let out of the hot seat, officer Melissa Saenz testified via video uplink. This is one of the officers that responded the night of that last, final fight of the marriage, the one where Amber insisted that Johnny threw a phone at her face and otherwise roughed her up.

QC tried to insist that OMS didn’t get a very good look at Amber’s face, and that there were injuries to Amber’s face that OMS missed, or didn’t see, or whatever. But OMS remained completely certain that she did get a very good look at Amber, and that there were no marks. There were no signs of violence whatsoever, on Amber or at the scene.

Like she did with Johnny, QC pulled the tactic of calling OMS a liar and interjecting her own scenario. But OMS weathered it brilliantly and refused to change her account of the evening.

I’m not sure what QC thought she was going to get away with, trying to call OMS a liar. OMS is a trained professional, an expert in domestic violence. But all she succeeded in doing was making herself look foolish.

That’s about all I caught from today. More as I hear about it.

On a personal note, I simply don’t see how Johnny can’t come out on top. Where the defense had nothing but “suggestions” and self-imposed testimony, the offense – Johnny’s team – has receipts for everything. Medical records and whatever else they need to prove their side of the case. I think it’s a slam dunk.

Next up: Probably updates about how Amber Heard is out until late/early every morning partying it up, seeming to take none of this seriously. And never mind Covid 19 in the crowds.

Photo of the court by Nick Wallis

title: Johnny Depp in court: Day Three
description:
Day three saw more of the same badgering from the Sun’s counsel, who I’ll refer to as QC. Today, she addressed two incidents of what she called violence against Amber Heard at the hands of Johnny Depp.

First, QC talked about what happened in Australia when Johnny lost the tip of his finger. QC badgered Johnny with Amber’s ever-changing version of events. Now, Amber’s saying that she slept through the night and morning when Johnny chopped off his own finger and trashed the house – though she did make a statement in documents that she’s the one that broke the TV, belying her story that she woke up in the morning to find all this horror.

Johnny held his own, though, giving answers that were at times humorous and I daresay sassy. It was refreshing to see that he adamantly refuses to let Amber’s team get away with her fictional version of events.

It was rather horrifying, though, to see Johnny describe how the bone was sticking out of his devastated finger, and being so ruined himself that he did indeed write on the walls and mirrors in his own blood.

The judge and Johnny’s counsel were heard from a lot more today, objecting when QC stepped out of line, giving Johnny more of a chance to answer questions without being interrupted. Not that there were many questions. It was more like QC giving testimony and interrupting Johnny when he tried to answer to the fictional charges she was laying out.

QC also described the incident in the penthouse where Amber Heard said she hit Johnny for the first (and only?) time, in defense of her sister Whitney. Amber insists that Johnny was pushing Whitney around to try to get at Amber to abuse her. Johnny patently denied that version of events the same way he denies her version of all of these events.

As court wrapped up, it became known that Johnny’s lawyer will have an hour to redirect – to question Johnny again about certain points that QC addressed during her cross examination. I think that’s good. After being raked over the coals for three days, Johnny will get a chance to set the record straight.

On another amusing note, it seems that our little petition has been mentioned in court documents. See the picture. It seems that Amber Heard is bugged by our efforts. And to that, I say: GOOD. She needs to know that actions have consequences, and it’s not always consequences you can control. She seems to be the type that likes to be in control, but she can’t control the petition, and she will never control me.

That’s about it for today. I’ll update as fast as I find out.

title: Johnny Depp in court, day two:
description:
Day two was really more of the same as yesterday, with the Sun's counsel badgering Johnny Depp about his drug and alcohol use, trying to guilt-bomb Johnny into admitting that taking any drugs and drinking alcohol turns him into a wife-beating monster.

But Johnny's having none of it. He won't admit to it because he never did it. He's never been violent with women and he's never been violent with Amber Heard.

The sun's counsel is leaning heavily on a fight on a plane wherein Amber Heard says that Johnny Kicked her, trying to get Johnny to say that if a man would kick a woman, doesn't that make him a wife-beater. Johnny's staying on top of it though, insisting that it didn't happen. And I guess Amber forgets that they weren't alone on the plane. There was a pilot, a stewardess, and two assistants. If any such kick took place, I'm sure it would have been in the headlines at the time.

Basically, the Sun's outta gas.

By the end of the day, the Sun was asking for more time to put Johnny on the stand, because, as she says, Johnny took too long answering questions and put her behind. It's a sneaky way of keeping Johnny in the hot seat and creating less time for the Sun and/or Amber Heard to have to explain themselves. I hope the judge sees right through it. 

Both parties have tomorrow to bicker about it, then the judge will make a ruling on how much extra time, if any, Johnny is on the stand again on Friday.

I don't know what the Sun's going to pull moving forward, but I'll do my best to keep you updated.

Special thanks to Nick Wallis on Twitter who's done a legendary job of live-tweeting the proceedings.

title: And so it begins
description:
Both Johnny Depp and Amber Heard have arrived at court in London. Johnny arrived looking dapper in a suit and tie, and wearing a black face mask. Amber showed up wearing the same black dress she wore when she went to court with fake bruises to get a TRO. 

Johnny has taken the stand for his testimony.

The Sleazeball defense lawyers have spent the entire day digging up every incident in the history of Johnny's life where they can try and make him out to be a violent monster, from when he allegedly trashed a hotel room when he was with Kate Moss to a time when he chased papz with a board when they were swarming his heavily pregnant partner, Vanessa Paradis. 

All they've managed to convey is that they don't have any current FACTS to hit him with, so they're throwing 20 and 30 year old articles at him.

Johnny's weathered it well, even getting a couple of snappy comebacks in here and there. I won't try to give you every detail because I'd fail miserably. Just know that our boy is holding up well, and is in good spirits. 

More as I discover it.

title: T- minus tomorrow
description:
Johnny Depp's libel case against the Sun tabloid starts tomorrow.

Hang onto your seats, gang. It's going to be a bumpy ride.

I'll update you as fast as I hear about what's going on.

In the meantime, let's all send Johnny Depp happy vibes. This might well be the first time he's been in the same room with Amber Heard in a long time. May he have the strength to tough it out.

title: Heard will be present when Johnny Depp testifies
description:
Court has ruled that Amber Heard, Johnny Depp’s ex-wife, can be present in the courtroom when Johnny testifies. Johnny’s legal team tried to have her banned until or unless such a time as she might be called on to testify herself, but that bid was lost. That means that she can and likely will sit there watching Johnny Depp testify about why he’s not a wife-beater, and the Sun tabloid is guilty of libel by calling him such.

The case is planned to be heard in a UK court on Tuesday. NGN’s legal team failed to get the case thrown out of court earlier this week.

In UK criminal cases, witnesses cannot be present in court while others testify. However, they can be present in civil cases. Depp hoped to ban Heard by claiming her testimony would be influenced if she was present while he was cross-examined.

In a court order published today, Justice Nicol rejected that argument.

This is a classic abuser’s intimidation tactic, to stare down the victim as they testify, hoping to frighten or otherwise affect Johnny’s testimony. Maybe she thinks that he’ll see her baby greens and melt.

Me, I hope the judge sees this attempt at manipulation for what it is and calls her on it if she so much as blinks wrong at Johnny. It won’t make a difference in the Sun libel case, but any shenanigans she pulls can be carried directly to Depp’s defamation case in January, 2021.

Depp’s libel suit against the Sun is set to begin next week, on Tuesday, July 7th, and could last up to three weeks, before the judge alone hands down his verdict.

SOURCE

title: Depp's libel suit against the Sun will proceed
description:
In a hail Mary bid to get the suit dismissed, the Sun (et al) filed a motion to dismiss over texts they say Depp didn't submit to the court. 

It didn't work.

The judge has decided that Johnny Depp's litigation against The Sun owner News Group Newspapers over a 2018 article in the tabloid that cast him as a "wife beater" can go ahead.

The trial is set to start next Tuesday, July 7th.

What do you think Johnny's chances are?

title: You have GOT to read this...
description:
Some froot loop managed to get this declaration filed in Johnny Depp's defamation case against Amber Heard in VA. In it, the author claims to be an undercover Federal agent who wrote a script for Johnny to star in, so Johnny owes her $25 million dollars.

She says that she personally witnessed Amber abusing Johnny (but we're only just now hearing from her), and that Amber wanted to have a 3-way with her and Johnny.

And she, the author of this lunatic filing, has a romantic history with Johnny Depp, because, of course she does.

Amber wanted this person's jacket, but she told Amber to fuck off. 

And she was able to boss Amber around when Johnny could not, forcing Amber to leave while she had a conversation with Johnny. In this conversation, Johnny disclosed to her that Amber blackmailed him into marrying him by threatening to blow her, the undercover Federal agent's, cover. If that happened, both she and johnny would be murdered.

So poor Johnny was FORCED to marry Amber to protect his friend with benefits, at peril of death.
 
You know, I've read some tall tales, but none made me laugh quite this hard. I don't know what amuses me more, the content, the fact that it actually got filed, or that there's some whack job out there crazy enough to do it.

Read it for yourselves, folks. This one takes the crazy cake.

title: Judge rules against Johnny Depp, but all is not lost
description:
In a hail Mary attempt to get the court thrown out, the Sun (et al) asked the court to throw out Johnny Depp’s libel suit by alleging that Depp failed to turn over texts about trying to obtain drugs. Justice Nichol has determined today that Johnny Depp did breached the order but did NOT dismiss the suit. Instead, the court has given Depp the opportunity to rescue the situation by applying for “relief against sanctions.” A hearing about the sanctions was set for later today.

I’ll post updates as fast as I get them.

Personally, I don’t see what those texts have to do with the Sun calling Johnny a wife beater, but the court says that the timing of those texts is significant because of the timing. They were said to occur during a 3 day period in Australia when Heard insists that she was abused. Which is rubbish, of course, but that’s what court is for. To sort out the mess.

The sun libel trial is set to commence on July 7th, if everything stays the course.

SOURCE

title: The petition at 451,000
description:
Our little petition has passed a milestone. First we hit the 450,000 mark, then eased over into 451. It makes me happy to see so many people willing to step up and take a stand for justice for Johnny Depp, a male survivor of domestic abuse. It’s important for people to recognize that men are victims, too.

I don’t expect Amber Heard to get fired because of this petition, though it would be nice to know we made such a difference. But what this petition really does is raise awareness.

Every time we make the news, there’s a chance that somebody new might read the petition and realize what Johnny Depp really went through at the hands of Amber Heard. It’s important for him to be vindicated, but it’s also important in the broader sense that men can be the victims of not only abuse, but the unsubstantiated accusations of some spiteful abuser that wants to ruin him. Any man can fall victim to it. Anybody can.

Most recently, a guy called ENTERTAINMENT HACKER made a video about us, and he explains beautifully how the petition can help raise awareness. It’s worth a look.

So, you see, it’s a cycle. The petition raises awareness, and the press reports on us, raising awareness about us so we can raise even more awareness about the issue.

Thank you to everybody who shares this petition, whether it’s through the media, or one person sharing the link. Each and every one of you is helping bring justice for Johnny, and raise awareness of a very important issue whose time has come.

You guys rock.

title: Amanda De Cadenet jumps ship
description:
#MeToo activist Amanda De Cadenet has withdrawn her support for “close” personal friend Amber Heard. Amanda says that she feels “used” and “misled” by Amber Heard after hearing heard abuse ex Johnny Depp in audio tapes.

Amber Heard was expecting the long-time women’s rights activist to testify on her behalf Johnny Depp’s upcoming libel suit against the UK tabloid the Sun, which starts in just 12 days, and in Depp’s looming defamation suit against Amber Heard herself. Now, that’s not going to happen.

It remains unclear whether or not De Cadenet will testify on behalf of Johnny Depp.

If you recall, Amanda De Cadenet (center) was pictured with a smiling and bruise-free Amber Heard just hours after she (Heard) claimed that she was brutally attacked. But said nothing.

Still, the fact that one of Heard’s staunchest supporters and a leader in the #MeToo movement has withdrawn support for Heard is a HUGE development. title: Amber Heard refuses Hipaa
description:
Amber Heard continues to refuse to sign HIPAA releases for her medical records and instead wants Johnny Depp to trust that she has the records she believes to be relevant.

title: Johnny Depp is in London
description:

How do you think it's going to go down?

title: Cara Delevingne had a 3-way with Heard and Musk, testimony
description:

Josh Drew is the ex-husband of Amber Heard’s BFF Raquel Pennington. He and the (ex) Mrs. lived in one of the penthouses the Johnny Depp owned, free of charge, so he was privy to many of the goings-on in Heard’s nasty affairs.

In an interview with Depp’s attorney Benjamin Chew, Josh Drew admits that Rocky (Raquel, his then wife) told him that Amber Heard was having a three-way affair with both Cara Delevingne and Elon Musk.

There had been previous rumors that Heard and Delevingne were having an affair before and during the time of Depp and Heard’s divorce, but this is the first mention of a three-way with Heard, the supermodel and the billionaire.

Now, Cara Delevingne might find herself in the company of James Franco and Elon Musk, who have both been subpoenaed to testify in Heard and Depp’s legal struggles.

I’m betting that a casual affair with a couple of friends wasn’t worth the trouble of having to testify in court in front of a jury and the whole world wasn’t worth the public humiliation Delevingne stands to suffer.

This is relevant to the case because both of these people have seen her up close and can testify as to whether or not she had any injuries that she claimed were inflicted upon her. 

What do you think of this whole sordid mess?

title: Kaplan jumps ship
description:
Roberta Kaplan and her legal team have withdrawn from representing Amber heard. See the picture from the county's court website to see who Amber has left. It's getting pretty slim.

Think about this. The lawyer that represented Harvey Weinstein and Jussie Smollet doesn't want to represent Amber Heard anymore.

title: Melanie Inglessis will testify
description:
Amber Heard's former makeup artist Melanie Inglessis filed a motion asking not to have to testify via live feed in johnny Depp's upcoming libel case against the Sun Newspaper.

The motion was denied. She will have to testify.

If you remember, Melanie said in a declaration that she saw bruises around Amber Heard's eye(s) when she made the actress up for an appearance on the James Cordon late night show just a day or two after Heard claimed that her (then) husband Johnny Depp beat her up. 

However, other people, including Heard's stylist, have said that they saw no marks on Heard's face the very same day.

The Sun trial starts on 10 July, just one month away. 

How do you think it'll turn out?

title: Where did the money go?
description:
Johnny Depp’s legal team has issued subpoenas for any communication Amber Heard has had with the ACLU and Children’s hospital regarding the donations she’s supposed to have made to those charities.

Depp's team is asking for “communications” including, “any written or verbal exchanges between any person or persons or entities, including but not limited to verbal conversations, telephone calls, letters, e-mails, memoranda, reports, telegraphs, faxes, exhibits, drawings, text messages, and any other documents which confirm or related to the written or verbal exchange."

Specifically, the subpoenas are asking for "All documents that refer, reflect or relate to any donations made to YOU or for YOUR benefit by Ms. Heard, from January 1, 2016, through and including the present."

According to Depp and Heard’s divorce settlement, that the actress would get $7 million from the actor as an equalization payment. As a caveat to the payment, it was agreed upon that the money would be donated to charity.

Heard had cited those two charities, the ACLU and Children’s hospital as the charities to which she would donate, and Johnny offered to send the money straight to those organizations. Heard, however, declined, saying that to do so would change and violate the terms of their divorce.

So now, Johnny wants to know where the money went.

Questions to Amber’s PR team about the subpoenas have gone unanswered.

SOURCE

title: Amber Heard’s makeup artist is fighting it
description:
Mélanie Inglessis, Amber Heard’s former makeup artist is trying to quash the judge’s order for her to testify remotely during Johnny Depp’s libel case against the Sun magazine for labeling him a wife beater on its cover.

Inglessis said in a 2019 declaration that she saw bruises on Amber Heard’s face and covered them up with makeup for an appearance on the Late Show with James Cordon. The day before that, Heard had claimed the Depp gave her a black eye.

In the same declaration, she said that Amber told her “many times” that Depp had abused his then wife. Now, Inglessis doesn’t want to testify to that fact. In fact, she doesn’t want to testify at all.

On May 16, Inglessis filed a motion in California federal court asking Magistrate Judge Patrick J. Walsh to quash his order compelling her give live testimony via a video feed. She also informed the court that she's received "death threats and faced online harassment.” Inglessis also says her career as a celebrity makeup artist will suffer if she's forced to testify.

A hearing is set for June 10 to decide the matter.

It’s no wonder that Inglessis doesn’t want to testify, given that so many other people have testified that at the same time, they saw Heard without any bruises or marks on her face at all. Let’s not forget that Heard’s stylist, Samantha McMillen, styled Amber Heard for that same James Cordon show and swore that there wasn’t a mark on her. Not one.

There’s the picture from the show. What do you think?

More than five and a quarter million dollars. That's how much money Warner Bros stands to lose on Aquaman 2 if Amber Heard is in it. 

I reached that figure by multiplying the number of signatures on this petition by 12 - the average I'm using for movie tickets. 

And that doesn't count the people that plan to boycott the film that haven't signed this petition. The amount could top 6 or 7 million. That may not seem like a whole lot when you put it next to a billion, but there's no denying that it's a substantial chunk of change nonetheless.  

Amber Heard is already out of AM2 by all reports, but I still hope that Warner Bros is paying attention, just in case they reconsider. And I hope all the other studios are looking, too. Their public is speaking, and we don't want Amber Heard. We don't want her in movies and we don't want her plastered all over L'Oreal ads. We just don't want her at all. 

Keep up the good work signing and sharing this petition, as well as the one to boot her from L'Oreal. We the people are the ones with the real power when it comes to where the money goes. Let's make 'em listen.

title: L'Oreal condones domestic violence
description:
Even though more evidence against comes to light almost daily about what a monster Amber Heard is, L’Oréal continues to employ her as a spokesmodel. But Heard’s fate has yet to be officially confirmed in a court of law.

For L’Oréal, though, Heard’s innocence or guilt shouldn't really be the issue. The suspicion should have been enough. After all, if a man were accused of half the things Amber Heard has done, he would have been sacked on the spot. The fact that Amber Heard continues to be a spokesperson for L’Oréal can only mean that the brand condones domestic violence and abusers. They are firmly in their corner.

A responsible company that cares about the rights of abused people would have immediately distanced themselves from Heard. At the least, they would have withdrawn her images from public circulation whilst they awaited the outcome of the trial.

Instead, L’Oréal has done exactly the opposite, posting images of Amber Heard over the weekend, praising her for her inner strength and beauty. To add insult to injury, the very next image they posted was a pair of pink boxing gloves, further teasing at their support of violent behavior.

The outrage on Twitter was immediate and definite. It’s a slap in the face to all domestic violence survivors, and quite a few people didn’t hesitate to say so.

A LOT of people have sworn to boycott L’Oréal and the companies it owns - including Maybelline, Garnier, and Lancôme. I’m one of those people. I won’t touch anything those companies make, from hair care to lipstick.  I’ll buy the 99 cent knockoffs at the dollar store first.

If L’Oréal continues to endorse a known abuser, they will find themselves on the wrong side of history. There’s no telling what damage they stand to suffer. For a beauty company, it certainly won’t be pretty. And they will have only themselves to blame.

title: Amber Heard as Batwoman?
description:

title: That chat with Laura Divenere
description:
Amidst all of the legal wrangling back and forth between Amber Heard’s legal team and Johnny Depp’s, a conversation took place between Laura Divenere and Amber Heard. The chat itself isn’t much to write home about, just the two of them trash-talking Adam Waldman, Johnny’s lawyer, and crapping themselves about having to give depositions whether they like it or not.

What’s really interesting about this conversation, though, is that Amber Heard recorded it without Laura’s knowledge or consent (see photo). Normally that wouldn’t be a problem because so many states are one-party states, meaning that only one party in the conversation needs to give consent in order to record it. But California is not a one-party state. That means that if both (or all) parties don’t give consent, it’s illegal to record the conversation. It constitutes wiretapping, which carries a $250,000 fine and/or up to 1 year in jail.

You can read a transcript of the conversation between Amber and Laura HERE. Make of it what you will.

The question I have to as is this: How many laws does Amber have to break before she’s held accountable?

title: Vanessa, Winona, Kate James will testify
description:
The Judge has ruled that Amber Heard's drinking and claims that she doctored vaccination certificates to smuggle her dogs into Australia WILL be used against her in ex-Johnny Depp's libel case against The Sun. That’s pretty huge, as it shows Ms. Heard’s disregard for the law.

Winona Ryder’s, Johnny’s past girlfriend, will also testify that Johnny was never abusive towards her in any way. In her statement, Ryder said: “I cannot wrap my head around [Heard’s] accusations. He was never, never violent towards me. He [Depp] was never, never abusive at all towards me.”

Heard was not happy about the ruling. A spokeswoman for Heard said: “As the judgment today shows, Mr. Depp’s team has been attempting to introduce irrelevant evidence. This is one of the defining characteristics of their strategy – to adduce irrelevant evidence designed to smear Ms. Heard and distract from the facts so that people do not focus on Mr. Depp’s behaviour.”

In other words, she’s all butthurt that his past girlfriends get to say what a nice guy he is.

Unfortunately, testimony from David Killackey, Johnny Depp’s mechanic, was ruled irrelevant and will not be admitted. If you remember, Killackey was witness to threats from both Amber Heard and her father, as well as being sexually harassed by Heard herself.

We need to keep in mind that this is ONLY Johnny’s libel case against the Sun. ONLY about whether Johnny was abusive toward Amber Heard, not about her being abusive to him. Evidence that may be irrelevant to the libel case in the UK will probably be admissible in Johnny’s Defamation case in VA. We’ll most likely heard from Mr. Killackey then.

I for one can't wait to see how this plays out. What do you think?

title: It wasn't just Johnny she abused
description:
In the midst of the sh*tstorm of accusations flying back and forth between Johnny Depp and Amber heard, it’s important to remember that when someone is abusive, they generally have a history of abusing other people.

Lately, Amber Heard’s team has been accusing Johnny of abusing his past girlfriends, trying desperately to establish a pattern of abuse by Johnny.

That’s blown up in her face repeatedly, because those past girlfriends have shown up every time to defend him, saying that he’s a kind and gentle and was never violent with them.

Amber heard, on the other hand, has a long and storied history of showing violent tendencies with multiple people. She was arrested in 2009 and 9 for assaulting her wife Tasya Van Ree. Stories are still coming out about other women stepping forward to say that she also abused them.

Fast forward to the present and Amber’s current trials and tribulations. The stories about injuries she reportedly inflicted upon Johnny Depp – in her own words caught on tape – have been pretty well documented. I’m not here to recount all of them. I’d be here all day. Suffice it to say that she tortured him and nearly killed him on several occasions.

It does bear mentioning that it's not just Johnny that was affected by Heard's actions. His children were often in the house during these incidents and witnessed the immediate aftermath.

And there have been other victims of Amber’s wrath. Kate James, Heard’s former personal assistant, has come forward with horrifying and heartbreaking stories of the way she was treated at Amber Heard’s hands.

”Amber was regularly verbally and mentally abusive and would often scream at me in that way, over the smallest things. She would fly into blind rages where no-one could reason with her, and even if I was trying to offer an explanation, I didn’t think that she could hear me as she was so angry. It was like she thought regular things that can go wrong in any person’s life on any given day didn’t apply to her. Everything that went wrong was always my fault. I remember one occasion where she missed a connection on a flight on or around Christmas Day in 2012. My aunt was visiting from Australia at that time. She was screaming abuse at me for literally hours as though I had made it snow and caused the disruptions to the flight.”

One time, Amber Heard took James’ 4 year old son to use as a human prop in a photo shoot. If I recall correctly, Heard drove with the tiny toddler in the front seat without any restraint. Jame’s was horrified and couldn’t get her son away from Heard fast enough.

Then there’s David Killackey, who was reportedly threatened and sexually harassed by Amber Heard. David, who worked on both Heard and Depp's classic cars, claimed that Heard was abusive toward him and that her father, David Heard, made 'death threats' toward Depp in a phone call. Killackey said the abuse began after he told Heard that all work on the cars would have to be paid directly, rather than through Depp's management. “The reply I received was to verbally abuse me with expletives, threats and a continued rant over what she claimed was an unfortunate financial downturn of her personal finances caused by Mr. Depp. At one point she said "you motherf***er, you're screwing me!"

Another time, Heard asked Killackey to show her something in her car. Then, when they were both inside, Heard said suggestively that they were alone down there and that “anything could happen.” Killackey immediately exited the vehicle, spurning her advances, and that she became unpleasant after that.

Killackey said that he stopped communicating with Heard directly after a 'very unpleasant' call, and soon began to hear from her father instead. During one phone call about the repairs, David Heard allegedly told Killackey: 'That f***ing piece of s*** is f***ing me too because I'm supposed to get 10 percent of the money and without it I can't produce the movie I was gunna make!” David Heard went on to say: 'When I get to him I'm going to beat the s*** out of him' and 'I'm from Texas, and men from Texas carry 45's and Johnny is going to meet the f***ing end of mine!' Killackey claimed.  

Killackey reported the threats to the police.

Apparently, that apple didn’t fall far from the tree.

The point, here, is that it’s Amber Heard is the one that has a history of abusive behavior, not Johnny Depp. No matter how much smoke and mirrors she throws up to make it look like Johnny is the one who was violent, there is simply no getting away from the history of her own actions. And, soon enough, she’ll end up paying for them. He tacky little web is falling apart around her, and she’s got nowhere left to hide.

I, for one, can’t wait to see her finally meet her Karma. I only wish I could have a front row seat.

title: "Official" confirmation. Will we get it?
description:
We would all love to see official confirmation that Amber Heard has been fired. But when it comes to the entertainment industry, it’s not always that cut and dried.

Everybody in Hollywood might know for a fact that she won’t be returning as Mera in Aquaman 2. She might already know it herself. So could we. We could know that she’s already been dealt out of the movie and blacklisted from the DC universe, and blackballed in Hollywood, but might be waiting for “official” confirmation before we let ourselves believe it.

But that’s not always the way it goes in Hollywood. We might never get “official” confirmation. It’s entirely possible that the only confirmation we actually get is when they film and release the film without her in it.

I hear some Amber Stan in the back screaming: “But she has a contract! You’re stupid!” And that maybe true, on both counts. But consider this. Actors can be bought out of their contracts the same way athletes can, and for a variety of reasons. Remember when Robert Downey Junior couldn’t be insured because of his drug use? Didn’t the same thing happen to Linsey Lohan? That could be why. Or there could be a heinous breach of the contract’s morals clause. Could be she was just a nightmare to work with and they were looking for a reason to dump her.

It could be anything.

RDJ was able to regroup and make the world's best comeback, thanks to the friends he has in the industry, and I'm glad.

Whatever the reason, there’s every reason to believe that Amber Heard won’t be back in Aquaman 2. I don’t know if they’ll replace her as Mera, or if they’ll just write the character out and get Momoa a new love interest. Either way, the movie will be better for it. I, personally, look forward to enjoying it without her in it.

The moral of the story is a lot of fans already believe that Amber Heard is out. You may not, and that’s fine. But don’t hold your breath for “official” confirmation. It may not come. But when AM2 comes out without her, we’ll all be celebrating just the same.

I’m bringing the marshmallows to toast over the flames of her ruined career. Feel free to join me.

title: That reporter from the Times
description:
A few days ago, I was contacted by a journalist from the NYTimes, asking me about the petition. I was dumb and naïve, and I responded to her questions.

The reporter’s name is Rachel Abrams. In addition to the Times, she’s written pieces for Variety and other publications that favor Amber and Elon Musk, as well as others. I didn’t know that when I talked to her. I thought I was helping to get the petition some attention with a piece in the New York Times. I’m sure she was counting on that. And, sadly, she got it.

She asked me about why I started the petition. I told her that I started the petition because I was sick of the inequality in Hollywood. If a man were accused of half the things that Amber reportedly did, he would have been sacked on the spot. And, in fact, he was. Johnny got canned because of Amber’s WaPo op-ed.

She asked me if any famous names have signed. I said that I saw the name Nic Cage scroll by, but that there’s no way of knowing if that was the real Nicolas Cage showing support for his friend or if somebody was just using that name. No way to tell.

She asked for a list of people who have signed this petition, but don’t worry, kids. She did not get it. Under no circumstances would I serve you guys up that way. You’re safe with me.

She asked if I've talked to Adam Waldman. I told her that I have not.

She asked where I got my information for my updates, and I named several sources, like the Blast. I’m sorry to say that I also named Brian McPherson, ThatBrianFella on Twitter and Incredibly Average on Youtube. He truly is the best source for information, the way he scours every source available and reports on it objectively. I stressed that several times, his objectivity. It’s easy to lean in Johnny Depp’s favor when all the shady stuff is on Amber’s side, but Brian sticks to objectivity. That’s what makes him such a reliable source.

I was an idiot. I chatted away, thinking everything was on the up and up. And I hope they were. But there’s the very real possibility that I was just fodder for a hit piece she and her team are working on to make Johnny Depp and his fans look stupid, and I walked right into it.

Watch for her piece, folks. Only time will tell what spin she had in mind when she got me on the phone.

If she was legitimately interested in the petition, as she seemed, I hope she writes a piece that brings some attention to the inequality of cause and effect within Hollywood.

If, on the other hand, her intentions were duplicitous and I was played for a fool, I can only hope that I am kindly forgiven by the wonderful folks within the Depp community for being so naive. I intended only good.

We’ll have to wait and see.

title: Elon Musk melts down on Twitter.
description:
Following the birth of his latest son - I'd provide his name, but frankly, I can't understand it - Elon musk jumped on twitter to criticize UK coronavirus advisor Neil Ferguson, who just stepped down from his government post after getting caught breaking quarantine rules for a tryst with a married woman.

"What a tool," Musk wrote while retweeting an article about Ferguson's public indiscretion.

"The building staff testified under oath they let you in the building while Johnny was filming in Australia. Amber asked them to get you a fob so you had freedom to come and go. Security saw you multiple times while they were married," the person wrote to Musk.

Musk once again claimed that whoever gave a deposition was not telling the truth, and wrote:

"This person is wrong. Why does JD want to believe he got cucked so bad anyway!?"

“Cuck” is a concept borne out of insecurity: a fear that one is inadequate, sexually or otherwise, and that inadequacy will lead to the loss of the things that are important to him. ... Those who call others a cuck do so in the desperate hope that shreds of their own masculine and racial prominence can be protected.

So Elon Musk is taking pot shots at Johnny's masculinity, saying Johnny wasn't enough of a man for Amber, and that he himself was. The use of that word speaks volumes about Musk's own insecurities, though, rather than his intended insult toward Depp.

Johnny Depp isn't "Cucked." He's more than adequate as a man and as a human being. Otherwise, he wouldn't be such a target for a toxic narcissist who tried to take advantage of him, ruin him, and possibly even kill him. 

Seems to me that Musk should have better things to do with his time these days, like basking in the glory of being a new father.

But that's just me.

Drop your thoughts below.

title: Amber Heard faked a bloody nose with nail polish
description:

Heard had requested a dismissal on the basis of the statute of limitations because the events referenced occurred back in 2016. But the judge rejected her claim because the defamation suit was filed within four months of the op-ed's publication, well within the statute. 

The Defamation case is due to be heard in August.

title: Amber Heard's glaring perjury

Think about how crazy stupid in love with her he was. Is that really gone from within him? Or does he still have a soft spot for his "made up" ex wife? Could he see her, go all mushy and drop the defamation case?

I don't think so.

Four years is a long time, and a lot of things can happen. One of those things is that Johnny has recovered himself. He's gotten back who he is, and he's steeled his resolve to defend himself against allegations that just aren't true. Seeing her isn't going to make him lose that. I'd love to know what you guys think about why Amber Heard plans to show up in London next month to testify in the Sun case. Drop and comment and let me know what you think.

title: Depp's attorney hits back against fishing expedition
description:

Kaplan and Tina Tchen, the founders of the Time’s Up Legal Defense Fund, have a client list of accused abusers and hoaxers that includes Jussie Smollett, Harvey Weinstein and Amber Heard.

“In Mr. Depp’s view… Ms. Heard can never speak about the backlash she endured after reporting him, or about the death threats against her, without impliedly re-accusing him of abuse,” Kaplan writes. 
Well, duh. 
1) When Amber Heard describes herself as a survivor of domestic violence at the hands of Johnny Depp, she's committing defamation. So no. She CAN'T say it. 
2) Amber Heard and Johnny Depp both signed a divorce agreement that forbids them both from speaking negatively about each other. So, no. She CAN'T keep spewing her slanderous rhetoric. 
I'm pretty sure that Kaplan is smart enough to understand that premise, but she's a lawyer. She'll argue whatever she's paid to argue, especially in such a high-profile case.

Aside from which, is it just me, or does Amber Heard look pretty rough, lately? She looks bloated and pasty in recent photos, including this one. I wonder what's up with her.
